vision.notes: Ray-finned fishes inhabiting coastal tropical waters. Vision likely used for prey detection, predator avoidance, and mate recognition.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely present, enabling detection of water movement and vibrations for prey detection and predator avoidance. Can sense touch through body encased in bony plates.

chemoreception.notes: Likely uses chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water for locating food and potential mates.

camouflage.notes: Known to change colors to camouflage them, suggesting photoreceptors allow color differentiation.
